text: (upbeat music)

- Vertex is a global
biotechnology company.

We're using AWS and serverless
architectures in a number
of places in production at Vertex.

Most recently, we built a
small molecule search platform

using a serverless architecture
for a chemistry group
that wanted to be able to search
across billions of molecules.
So what we created for them was an API
so they could submit a request to
with their search criteria.
That API is using Amazon API Gateway.

And so when the request comes
in to Amazon API Gateway

from the scientists, it
has details of the search.
We then spin up this search fleet
that spins up many hundreds of workers

that comb through these,
you know, tens of billions

of molecules based on the
criteria that they gave us.
We tally up a list of the search results
and then send them back to the scientists
and spin the whole thing down.

We're trying to deliver
transformative medicines to patients

with serious diseases, and
the patients can't wait.

We have to get the drugs
to them as fast as we can.
And so all of our technology choices

the way that we hopefully
scale up into compute on AWS
is all with the goal of trying to arrive,

answer questions faster,
and get results back

to our scientists more quickly
to let them hopefully iterate
more quickly on their research.
